heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike was on 13 May 2025, at a distance of 4.97 miles.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 15 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: This period, starting 09 September 2025, is ranked 5th among the longest rainy periods since 23 September 2024.  It has lasted 9 days so far.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (196°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 623 m) and light levels (up 3709 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1108 m) and light levels (up 4947 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 622.8m lower than yesterday, 569.8m lower than the past week, 1107.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 850m to 2900m and averaged 923.9m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, extremely heavy humidity levels and winds will be practically absent. A few light raindrops may fall, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and some sunny spells will occur. Weather patterns to stay the same.
